params.name: labelcancel
params.description: The text to put on the cancel button of a prompt message box.

params.name: callbackHandler
params.description: callback function which will be called when any ok|no|cancel button is clicked

params.name: labelok
params.description: The text to put on a alert button and prompt messge box OK button.

params.name: title
params.description: The title for the message box.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of action to be performed

params.name: message
params.description: Message text which will be displayed

params.name: labelno
params.description: The text to put on the button used for a negative response in a confirm message box.

params.name: labelyes
params.description: The text to put on the button used for a positive responsein a confirm message box.

params.name: multiline
params.description: Applies for prompt action only. Signify whether prompt is textarea(multiliner) or oneliner(textField)Default=false

params.name: bodyStyle
params.description: A CSS style specification for the body of the message box. As a general rule, use this attribute to set color and font styles

params.name: buttonType
params.description:
Applies to the control type - confirm
The buttons to display on the message box

params.name: icon
params.description:
Specifies the following CSS classes
error: Provides the error icon. You can use this icon when displaying error messages.
info: Provides the info icon. You can use this icon when displaying any information.
question: Provides the question icon. You can use this icon in a confirmation message box that prompts a user response.
warning: Provides the warning icon. You can use this icon when displaying a warning message

params.name: modal
params.description: A Boolean value that specifies if the message box should be a modal window

params.name: width
params.description: Width of the message box in pixels.

params.name: x
params.description:
The X (horizontal) coordinate of the upper-left corner of the message box .
ColdFusion ignores this attribute if you do not set the y attribute.

params.name: y
params.description:
The Y (vertical) coordinate of the upper-left corner of the message box.
ColdFusion ignores this attribute if you do not set the x attribute.
